Many people with poor vision would struggle to see clearly and would have difficulty performing everyday tasks such as reading, driving, and working.
Some people with poor vision may rely on other assistive technologies such as magnifiers or screen readers to help them navigate their environment.
Others may use alternative methods of communication such as sign language or writing to communicate with others.
People with poor vision may have to adjust their daily routines and find new ways to do things, such as using tactile cues to navigate their surroundings.
Some people with poor vision may have to rely on others to help them with tasks that require clear vision, such as cooking or cleaning.
